nodes.text: I don't believe you.
You should talk to my daughter, Maida, about that. I don’t really keep track of what’s going on lately. Too much just keeping an eye on my own business.
Well, I don’t rightly know what all he said, but he seemed real excited about going. But I shouldn’t have let him go. He’s two weeks later getting back than he said he’d be and I’m worried.
Maida free Sulik. Maida friend.

Well, Smiley and me were getting downright serious with each other. I thought I had finally gotten him to agree to settle down here and help me run this place. But, he said he needed to go off  on one last quest.
Well, somehow that doesn’t surprise me much. Oh my, I yelled at my poor boy when it wasn’t even his fault. (sob) I’ll get those Duntons. They’ve gone too far this time.

Oh, thank you. Let me mark on your map where he talked about looking. I sure hope you can find him. He isn’t much, but I still love him and I miss him more than I thought I could. Please find  him for me.
You remind me of my boy Torr. I bet the two of you would get along just fine. Why don’t you run and talk to him? Goodbye.

Well, he kept saying that he was going to go get the bugmen where they live. You see, there’s a canyon just east of the field where we graze the brahmin. Lately, there’ve been some strange noises  coming from there.
I just don’t know what to think. My boy Torr’s missing. I sure wish someone would help me find him. He’s never been gone from home so long before.
My poor Torr's run off.
Have you found my son, Torr, yet? I'm so worried about him.
You didn't see a trapper named Smiley outside of town did you? (half to herself) He's been gone for too long. Never should have let him go off on that fool quest of his.
Have you found my Smiley yet?
I thought they were up to their usual tricks! My poor little Torr. I'll take care of those two bullies right away. They won't be doing that again. Thank you.
Well, let’s see here. We should have a room available. That will be $25.
I’m afraid you don’t have enough money for that.
I hear you hurt my boy Torr. I don’t know exactly what happened, but I don’t want you anywhere  near here. Now get out.
Well, I just don’t know what we could ever do to thank you.
I don’t have much, but here’s $100. I wish it could be more, but with all the Brahmin we’ve lost that’s all we can afford. I’m sorry.
I just handle the rooms here. If you want to buy or trade something, talk to my daughter, Maida.
I think something horrible must have happened to my poor boy, Torr. I was counting on you (sob) to find him before it was too late. That poor simple boy. I can’t believe I counted on you.
Well, surely there must be something that I can do to show you how grateful I am. Hmm, I’ll forgive Sulik’s debt. He’s free to go. I guess that not all tribals are troublemakers.
Have you found my Smiley yet?
How can I help you, friend?
You're the one that found my Smiley. Thank you, thank you so much.
Torr canyon.
Torr was sure that’s where the bugmen that he said were taking our brahmin came from. Said something about proving himself to us. I just wish someone would bring my boy back to me. go Torr.
You've found my son Torr. Thank you so much.
We’re pretty full right now. Sorry.
Hello there. My name’s Ardin Buckner and this is Buckner house.

Well, he called it a quest. He told me he thought he knew where all the golden geckos came from, and he wanted to find out for sure. He thought that maybe it was some kind of magical spring, or maybe a hidden cave or vault of some sort.
Eaten by geckos? I just don't believe you. Geckos would never catch my Smilely, he's too good a trapper for that. You must be mistaken.
Thank you for promising to look for my boy. I sure hope you can find him. I’m so worried about  him. Hurry, please.
Have you found my Smiley yet?
He took off last night. I got mad at him after we lost those last few brahmin. We just can’t afford to lose any more, but all he would talk about is the bugmen taking them. That fool boy.

links.text: Uh, I guess that was a bad *joke*, sorry.
Oh, it's true. They're probably both worm food by now - well, the few scraps that haven't been turned into gecko shit anyway. Well, them's the breaks. See ya.
Oh, okay, I’ll do that. Right now, though, I need some information about something else.
Well, I’ll talk to her about that then. Goodbye.
I’d like to help. I could look for him for you.
Sorry to hear that. Let me ask you about something else.
That’s too bad, Mrs. Buckner. Maybe he just ran out on you. I think I know why he would, too.  Goodbye.
I’m glad that you don’t need Sulik anymore. There’s something I want to ask you.
Thank-you. I’m sure Sulik will be grateful for your forgiving his debt to you. I’ll talk to Maida right away. Goodbye.
A quest?
I’m sorry about that. Where do you think Torr went?
I’ll do what I can. Let me ask you something first, though.
You know, I just don’t think I can help you right now. Goodbye.
I’ll do my best, Mrs. Buckner. Goodbye
Noises?
Noises?
Well, I can tell you’re busy. I’ll come back later. Goodbye.
That’s nice, lady, but I need something from you.
Torr?
They're both dead as doornails.
Smiley's dead.
I'm still looking for them. I better get back to it. Goodbye.
Torr left? What do you mean?
Torr's dead.
Smiley's dead.
I'm still looking for them. I better get back to it. Goodbye.
Torr left? What do you mean?
Torr's dead.
They're both dead as doornails.
Smiley? No, I haven’t seen a trapper by that name. Tell me about him.
Hello, Ardin. I think I’ll be moving along now. Goodbye.
Sorry, Mrs. Buckner. I’m still looking for him. Let me ask you something else first, though.
No, I’m just about to go look for him though. Goodbye.
Those Duntons make me sick. I'm glad you'll take care of them. Goodbye now.
Happy to help, ma'am. Let me ask you about something.
I don’t think I want that right now. Let me ask you something else.
I’ll take it. Here’s the $25. Thanks.
I don’t think I need the room after all. Goodbye.
Oops. I guess I am a bit light right now. Let me ask you something else.
I’m sorry. I better go make some more. Goodbye.
If you could consider Sulik’s debt paid, that would be reward enough.
Well, money is always a nice way of saying thanks.
No thanks is necessary. Help was needed and I was there.
Thanks Ms. Buckner. Goodbye.
Thanks. Goodbye.
Oh, I see. Tell me something else then.
Maybe I can help recover what’s left of his body for you. Goodbye.
Sorry, Mrs. Buckner. I tried my best to find him for you. Uh, there was something I wanted  though.
That sounds good to me. Goodbye.
I, uh, saw him. He said he was running off with another woman. Whoa! Look at the time. I've gotta run.
Uh, I, uh, we, that is...Uh, no. I'm still looking for him. I'm sure he'll show up any day now. Uh, Goodbye.
Who? Oh, uh, no. I don't know where he went. Uh, say, let me ask you about something else.
He's dead. He was eaten by geckos.
Tell me about Smiley, the trapper.
I was wondering if you’re the person to talk to about local news and events?
I guess I don’t need anything right now. Goodbye.
I need a room, please.
I want to buy something.
Smiley got lucky this time. You just tell him to be a bit more careful.
Sounds as though that canyon would be a good place to start looking. I’ll go look for your boy,  Mrs. Buckner.
No go Torr.
Sounds as though that canyon would be a good place to start looking. I’ll go look for your boy,  Mrs. Buckner.
No go Torr.
Torr just needs a little help from time to time. I'm glad I was there for him.
Ok.
Argl. Goop
Hmmm.
Nope, I saw him, or what was left of him anyway. Not a pretty sight. Well, see ya later. Goodbye.
Yeah, you're probably right. Sorry for the scare. Let me ask you about something.
I guess you've got me there. Heh, heh, I was just pulling your, ah, leg. Yeah, that's it. Well, Goodbye.
Ok.
Torr's dead.
They're both dead as doornails.
Smiley's dead.
I'm still looking for them. I better get back to it. Goodbye.
Torr left? What do you mean?
I think that the Duntons had something to do with the missing brahmin. You shouldn’t be too hard on Torr about it. Where do you think he went?
Torr go?
